title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.001
frontText: What word would you use to describe being followed online in a hostile way?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.002
frontText: What word would you use to describe a large number of people bullying an individual user online?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.003
frontText: What word would you use to describe the online publication of an individual’s private identity and contact information?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.004
frontText: True or false: There are no exceptions to your right to insist on your private data remaining private.
backText: False. Governments, employers, and contractual agreements can sometimes represent exceptions.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.005
frontText: What web browser technology can be used to store detailed elements of your browsing history?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.006
frontText: True or false: You should assume that the privacy of your personal data will always be respected by all online services you use.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.007
frontText: Where is much of the private data stolen by hackers eventually stored?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.008
frontText: What is the primary goal of European Union’s General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)?
backText: To protect the privacy and safety of data moving through the European Union

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.009
frontText: What is the primary goal of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI‐DSS)?
backText: To ensure that organizations involved in processing financial transactions do so safely and securely

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.010
frontText: What contextual element of an information website can (often) inspire confidence in the quality of its content?
backText: It was created by a government of academic agency.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.011
frontText: What word describes unsolicited messages sent to your email address?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.012
frontText: What word describes malicious attempts to reveal your private authentication information under false pretenses?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.013
frontText: Why should you carefully read the URL address of every website you visit?
backText: To make sure it’s the right site (and not a fake, like gmall.com)

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.014
frontText: How would you explain the principle of nonrepudiation?
backText: A system configuration where all actions can be positively traced to the executing user or account

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.015
frontText: True or false: A “threat” is a misconfiguration, oversight, or hole in your defenses.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.016
frontText: Which relatively new category of connected compute devices presents a particular potential threat to network security?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.017
frontText: What is the most likely goal of telephone scammers?
backText: Access to your banking information...and money

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.018
frontText: What nonmilitary reason could a government agency have for illegally accessing foreign private data?
backText: To learn and gain from commercial trade secrets

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.019
frontText: Besides taking your money, how can someone who has stolen your personal identity use it against you?
backText: By blackmailing you into acting in their interest

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.020
frontText: What’s the best protection against the possible hostile destruction of your data?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.021
frontText: What’s the best protection against attackers using OS software vulnerabilities to gain access to your systems?
backText: Regularly update and patch your OS and software packages

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.022
frontText: How do for‐profit companies (like Google) that permit the free use of their web browsers monetize their product?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.023
frontText: True or false: Creating a good OS login password is all you’ll need to properly protect your computer.
backText: False: Without encrypting your data and/or creating a BIOS/UEFI password, it will still be possible to access your data without booting to the OS drive.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.024
frontText: A ______________ is an undocumented (and often unauthorized) access route to a computer system.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.025
frontText: True or false: The 802.11 standard is used by Bluetooth technology‐driven devices.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.026
frontText: Which free online service can tell you if any of your authentication credentials have been exposed online?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.027
frontText: In the context of software security, what is a “trojan horse”?
backText: Software that performs a useful task while also invisibly executing an attack

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.028
frontText: What kind of attack involves flooding an online service with fake requests in order to consume all its available resources?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.029
frontText: What category of surveillance software can record all of the text‐based activities you engage in on your PC or server?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.030
frontText: What’s a quick and easy way to launch a clean OS on a PC and accessing local data but without having to boot the installed OS?
backText: Using a Linux “live boot” USB device

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.031
frontText: What’s an easy way for a dishonest PC repair technician to introduce malware on a customer’s computer?
backText: By plugging a “pre‐contaminated” USB device into the customer’s PC

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.032
frontText: What’s the “best” way to expose many—or all—of your online accounts to malicious attack?
backText: By using the same password across multiple accounts—once one is exposed, they all are.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.033
frontText: What’s the best way to ensure you (or your users) will consistently use only long, complicated, and unique passwords?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.034
frontText: What authentication system requires a user to provide more than just a password?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.035
frontText: Which process controls the access users are allowed within a typical multi‐user compute environment?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.036
frontText: How can systems hosting many users requiring varying levels of access easily and efficiently manage authorization?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.037
frontText: How are firewall rules typically described?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.038
frontText: True or false: Software firewalls running on simple, inexpensive servers can perform largely the same access control functions as more expensive hardware firewalls.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.039
frontText: An instance‐based software firewall on Amazon Web Service’s EC2 service is known as a __________________.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.040
frontText: At which layer of the OSI model does an application firewall operate?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.041
frontText: Which part of the following URL represents the hostname? https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1119490707

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.042
frontText: Which part of the following URL represents the communication protocol? https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1119490707

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.043
frontText: What is the official software package manager used by the Ubuntu Linux OS?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.044
frontText: Which networking protocol is used to carry web pages using the HTML language?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.045
frontText: What is the function of the Internet Protocol (IP)?
backText: The protocol defines how network packets are moved between source and destination hosts.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.046
frontText: Which protocol is used to limit the number of public IPv4 addresses in use while providing many thousands of addresses for private networks?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.047
frontText: True or false: 175.0.45.100 is a valid private IP address available for use by NAT routers.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.048
frontText: How many bits are used by a single IPv6 IP address?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.049
frontText: By default, to which resources will a browser look first for a DNS translation between a domain and its IP address?
backText: A local address translation service on the local machine

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.050
frontText: What describes an attack that corrupts responses to DNS requests made by your computer?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.051
frontText: What is a network configuration that allows a network host to direct incoming requests between multiple running services?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.052
frontText: How many octets of the following IPv4 address range describe the network portion: 10.0.0.0/16?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.053
frontText: True or false: This nmap command will scan the network configuration of only a single network host: nmap 10.0.0.0/16.
backText: False. That would be something like nmap 10.0.0.4.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.054
frontText: What is a powerful tool for analyzing network packets for unexpected or illegal network activity?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.055
frontText: Why is connecting to public Wi‐Fi hotspots a greater potential risk than the data connection offered by your cell provider?
backText: Cell carrier connections are direct, secure, and established, while Wi‐Fi connections can easily be spoofed or simply insecure.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.056
frontText: What process can obscure sensitive private data from unauthorized access?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.057
frontText: Which encryption process requires an identical secret key to be present at both the encryption and decryption steps?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.058
frontText: True or false: Asymmetric encryption can require more compute power to manage than symmetric encryption.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.059
frontText: In which significant way is hashing different than encryption?
backText: A hash cannot be converted back to readable text, while encryption is reversible.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.060
frontText: True or false: Desktop machines that are seldom moved between locations are generally the most urgent candidates for full‐disk encryption

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.061
frontText: What is the primary purpose of a blockchain?
backText: To provide reliable and unalterable records of transactions

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.062
frontText: What is it about blockchains that require the use of such intense compute resources?
backText: The need for each node to confirm the cumulative hashes of the entire chain

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.063
frontText: ____________ is a free tool for managing the encryption of disk drives running any major OS.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.064
frontText: What service will manage the encryption keys you use for data you use throughout your AWS account?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.065
frontText: What type of cryptographic objects are generated for use by blockchains?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.066
frontText: True or false: The Telnet remote session tool is, by design, encrypted and secure.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.067
frontText: What should you check to confirm that a website you’re visiting is properly encrypted?
backText: That the URL begins with HTTPS rather than just HTTP

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.068
frontText: What protocol is currently the best one to use to encrypt web pages?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.069
frontText: What kind of organization is qualified to oversee public encryption infrastructure?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.070
frontText: Which organization provides free encryption certificates on request?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.071
frontText: What is the function of perfect forward secrecy (PFS)?
backText: To prevent the misuse of website session keys

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.072
frontText: True or false: From a security standpoint, it’s acceptable for a smaller organization to use self‐signed encryption keys for internal resources.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.073
frontText: What open source tool can you use to encrypt individual files?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.074
frontText: True or false: Gmail messages are automatically encrypted from end to end.
backText: False. They’re encrypted only while in transit (with other encrypted services), but not once they reach your mailbox.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.075
frontText: How can checksums help ensure the software packages you download are reliable?
backText: You can compare a package’s “official” checksum with one you generate from the file you’ve downloaded.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.076
frontText: What describes “open source intelligence”?
backText: Information about you or your organization that’s freely available online through platforms like LinkedIn and Facebook

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.077
frontText: What’s a free tool for automating open source intelligence reconnaissance?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.078
frontText: How does using the Shodan (shodan.io) tool help for open source intelligence research?
backText: It can point you to sensitive images that you or your organization may have online.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.079
frontText: What is the best online source of reliable vulnerability management data?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.080
frontText: What are the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE)?
backText: The CVE is a naming standard for security vulnerabilities and exposures.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.081
frontText: What is the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS)?
backText: An objective numeric measure of a system’s vulnerability

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.082
frontText: How is penetration testing different from vulnerability scanning?
backText: Penetration tests seek to access the target system, while vulnerability scans involve passive information gathering.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.083
frontText: Which Linux distribution comes pre‐bundled with a full suite of penetration testing and vulnerability scanning tools?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.084
frontText: What must you always acquire before starting a penetration test?
backText: Explicit authorization from the target’s owners

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.085
frontText: What is the purpose of “red team/blue team” exercises?
backText: To test the abilities of your infrastructure’s defenders (the blue team) against simulated attackers (the red team)

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.086
frontText: What is absolutely required before you can be confident that your application backup protocol will work?
backText: You need to test restoring your data from the backup media onto an actual system.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.087
frontText: What describes the system state you need to be able to recover that, in the event of an application outage, will be current enough for your organization’s minimum requirements?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.088
frontText: What describes the time within which you would need to get your system back up and running before your organization suffers serious damage?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.089
frontText: Despite its many advantages, there are some cases where backing up to a cloud service (like AWS) won’t be technically feasible. What’s a common problem?
backText: Your backup archives are so large that they would take months to upload using your existing Internet bandwidth

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.090
frontText: Why should you save backups to multiple platforms and media?
backText: Because any one physical medium can fail and any one platform can go out of business

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.091
frontText: What’s the best way to ensure that your backups run regularly?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.092
frontText: What US government law governs the protection and retention of private data held by your organization?
backText: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.093
frontText: What type of backup will copy and back up only objects changed since the previous partial backup?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.094
frontText: What is a warm backup?
backText: A configuration where replacement infrastructure is kept running 24/7 but without access to up‐to‐date application data—it would need to read that data before becoming available in an emergency.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.095
frontText: What is the primary purpose of account isolation?
backText: To allow compute operations while reducing the risk of dangerous leaks between environments

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.096
frontText: What is a “private network”?
backText: A network with no or limited access to and from the Internet (or, in the case of NAT subnets, a network using private IP addressing)

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.097
frontText: What is a bastion host?
backText: A server that’s accessible from untrusted networks. Remote SSH sessions on the bastion host can be used as a platform to safely access servers in the connected private network.

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.098
frontText: What is a sandbox environment?
backText: A physical or virtual network that’s closed off from external access in which experimental or risky workloads can run

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.099
frontText: What do we call a physical barrier preventing any incoming or outgoing access?

title: fc196531.LPISecEssSG.100
frontText: What is mandatory access control (MAC)?
backText: A permissions profile where access restrictions are difficult or impossible to override even for users with some administration powers
